newsitem.title: BELGIUM: DHL to expand use of European sub-hubs.
newsitem.headline: DHL to expand use of European sub-hubs.

text.p: DHL will make more use of European sub-hubs due to the rapid expansion of its Brussels headquarters, a DHL spokesman told Reuters.
"It is our strategy to create more sub-hubs to avoid everything coming in through Brussels," he added.
DHL is experiencing average growth of 20-25 percent a year at Brussels, although February saw a 35 percent rise over 1996 levels.
Last year, the operator handled 155,000 tonnes in 1996 at Brussels representing 36 million consignments, he added.

DHL's existing European hubs are at East Midlands in the UK, Amsterdam, London, Paris, Madrid, Nuremberg, Vitoria, Brussels, Frankfurt, Cologne, Copenhagen and Bergamo. It also looking for a hub on the French-Swiss border.
This follows last year's decision not to operate a Rhine valley sub-hub at Strasbourg after environmental objections by local inhabitants and politicians.
The spokesman said although there is capacity to expand in Belgium, DHL is also keen to make more use of the regional hub system.

"For instance it is not efficient for shipments that are being sent within Scandinavia to travel all the way to Brussels to be sent back there, therefore we have a sub-hub in Copenhagen." - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
